event_text: The apprentices of the Clan are taking special training to learn how to disguise their scents from enemies with kelp and seawater.
m_c plucks a few pristine white flowers from the camp's nearby frangipani bush. {PRONOUN/m_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/m_c/wear/wears} it with genuine joy, brighter than the beachy sun.

r_c, inbetween grooming m_c, tucks the prettiest frangipanis they could find next to m_c's ear. m_c almost doesn't notice the next morning, and purrs a thank you to r_c when {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/walk/walks} by.
m_c plucks a few marigolds from a nearby flower patch. {PRONOUN/m_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/m_c/wear/wears} it with poise.
r_c, inbetween grooming m_c, tucks marigolds next to m_c's ear. m_c almost doesn't notice the next morning, and purrs a thank you to r_c when {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/walk/walks} by.

m_c's eyes sparkle as {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/realize/realizes} something wonderful --- {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} can propagate the reeds on c_n territory, and decorate {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} nest with it! A week later, m_c is seen sleeping soundly with thick stalks of dark green reeds casting shadows on {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} pelt.

r_c has a wonderful idea for decorating m_c's nest! m_c wakes up in the middle of the night with reeds brushing {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} face. Despite the slight scare it gave m_c, {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/thank/thanks} r_c in the morning for the nice surprise.
m_c curiously pokes and prods at a crab that wandered into camp. The crab, unbothered to m_c's antics, seems relaxed enough to keep as a pet. m_c cheerfully shows off {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} new friend!

r_c decides to stop by the apprentice's den, asking if m_c would like a crab. m_c nods with big eyes, and r_c plops down the critter as it still attempts to crawl while on it's back. m_c doesn't crack {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} jaws into it's shell like expected. Instead, m_c flips it over and ogles it curiously. Seems like m_c has found a new friend...?
m_c grumbles incoherently as {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/trudge/trudges} back to camp, soaked and with {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} tail knotted and wrapped with seaweed. Poor m_c.
m_c received a present, dried but vibrant acc_plural, from r_c and decided to keep it with {PRONOUN/m_c/object} on {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} tail.
